intro: Callisthene microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved callisthene, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its botanical features include a sprawling or upright growth habit, with hairy stems and glandular leaves that contribute to its adaptability in arid conditions.
